sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: Returns the TCP/IP numeric address of the machine the program is running on. The numeric address is of the form xxx.yyy.zzz.www where each segment is a number from 0 to 255.
sections.text_content: Returns the TCP/IP numeric address of the machine the program is running on. The numeric address is of the form xxx.yyy.zzz.www where each segment is a number from 0 to 255.
sections.mdown_content: Returns the TCP/IP numeric address of the machine the program is running on. The numeric address is of the form _xxx_._yyy_._zzz_._www_ where each segment is a number from 0 to 255.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The Net module requires a TCP/IP stack to be installed and operating in order to function. It does not communicate using any other protocols

It is possible for Firewalls to interfere with the actions of the Net module, preventing connections from taking place.
sections.text_content:
The Net module requires a TCP/IP stack to be installed and operating in order to function. It does not communicate using any other protocols
It is possible for Firewalls to interfere with the actions of the Net module, preventing connections from taking place.
sections.mdown_content:
The **Net** module requires a TCP/IP stack to be installed and operating in order to function. It does not communicate using any other protocols
It is possible for Firewalls to interfere with the actions of the **Net** module, preventing connections from taking place.

sections.title: Example
sections.raw_content: The following program prints out the TCP/IP numeric address of the current machine.
sections.text_content: The following program prints out the TCP/IP numeric address of the current machine.
sections.mdown_content: The following program prints out the TCP/IP numeric address of the current machine.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Net.LocalAddress, not by calling LocalAddress.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Net.LocalAddress, not by calling LocalAddress.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Net.LocalAddress**, not by calling **LocalAddress**.
